verses.roman:
gauḍeśvara yavana-rājā prabhāva śuniñā
kahite lāgila kichu vismita hañā

synonyms: gauḍa-īśvara—King of Bengal; yavana-rājā—Muslim king; prabhāva—influence; śuniñā—hearing; kahite—to say; lāgila—began; kichu—something; vismita—astonished; hañā—becoming.
translation: When the Muslim King of Bengal heard of Caitanya Mahāprabhu's influence in attracting innumerable people, he became very astonished and began to speak as follows.

purport.content: At that time the Muslim king of Bengal was Nawab Hussain Shah Bādasāha.
